alert.note: Alert for Fresno (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 14 at 11:08AM PDT until March 15 at 10:00PM PDT by NWS Hanford
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 215 PM PDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Urban area and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central California, including the following county, Fresno. * WHEN...Until 215 PM PDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1106 AM PDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Coalinga and Huron. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
